Reviews.Title: “An interesting little hotel not far from the Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: DMacIntyre
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at the Emona and we were quite happy with our room and the location of the hotel. Although we would not necessarily classify it as a 4 star hotel, it was more than adequate for our needs. We got the hotel on a 40% discount so the price was right for sure. Because we were travelling with our teenage grandaughter, we asked for a triple rom and they gave us a decent sized room (by European standards) with enough space to move around and spread out our luggage. The beds were confortable enough although the matresses were a bit soft for our liking. The bathroom was large and had nice tiling and modern fixtures including a large jacuzzi tub. Unfortunately there was only a handheld shower which was a bit awkward to use. The hotel is quite eclectic and is decorated with an interesting mix of modern and traditional art. The breakfast was fairly average but there was enough variety to keep us happy. The location is not bad - right across the street from ruins of an ancient aqueduct and within 10 minutes walk to the Colosseum. The nearest metro station is about 5 minutes away. The neighbourhood has a number of small boutique style hotels but there is not much in the way of shops or restaurants until you get closer to the Colosseum. Try Tratoria Luzzi if you want a cheap and tasty meal but go early - it is packed with locals. The only negative comment we have is that our room was at the back of the hotel overlooking the courtyard which in the evening is a gathering place for hotel patrons wanting to party. This can get quite noisy at times. We were on the first floor. Rooms on higher levels might be quieter. The staff were reasonably helpful and friendly. When it was time for us to leave they made arrangements for a car and driver to take us to the airport which has much better than a regular taxi and the same price. Overall our experience with this hotel was positive and we would recommend it if you can get it at a discounted price.

Reviews.Title: “No way 4*”
Reviews.Author: naomiwLondon
Reviews.Content: More 2/3* Stayed there 4 nights and my back knows it. To say the bed was hard is an understatement, luckily there was a small sofa bed in the room so I added that mattress which helped. We asked to change room on arrival but were told they were full and we had been upgraded to a superior room - god knows where we were meant to be. The room/hotel is quirky. Jacuzzi bath which smelt bad when you put on the jets. Had a shower tap with connector on wall but it kept falling off - no shower curtain. Only shampoo and small soap provided. No robe etc provided. Not even any hotel information in the room. Room very noisy and hot - told no air conditioning available until summer but we were in a heat wave. Internet usage is free but kept cutting out in bedroom if available. No bar or restaurant, breakfast area. Breakfast boring, exactly the same each day and little choice - all self service. Coffee (IN ROME!!! instant). Eggs - overcooked scrambled and bacon all fat. Nice fruit salad. Staff were very nice and helpful with suggestions of where to eat and booked excursions for us. The tour of the Colosseum had dreadful guide and we lost 1/5 of the time as people arrived late at meeting point (from the coach collection) - did not even get to see the Palentine which is worth going to see so you have to pay again. Vatican had excellent guide. 10 mins walk from Metro. 20 mins walk from Colosseum. Take good shoes as you do a lot of walking on uneven ground. Rome has lovely sights but the streets are dirty, lots of dog mess and litter. Masses of graffiti and people rude. Not what we had imagined it to be. Coffee out and about fabulous and ice cream parlour near hotel not to be missed. Gelateria Giovanni Fassi, Palazzo del Freddo. Never felt the need to write a review before which shows how strongly we felt.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: gcfeio
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights. The first night was somewhat hectic as the room was too close to the street and one could here all the street noise. We asked to change rooms and we were given another room, this time with better noise proof windows and on the 3rd floor (not facing the street). Staff is very helpful and friendly - gave us a few important tips on the city and helped on museum ticket reservations. Breakfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “Personal, efficent”
Reviews.Author: maxmix
Reviews.Content: Very nice place gret view. Very special place not only in rome but in europe( as fare as i travelt) I gave the highest points because of the exelent service. I was welkomed like amember of a italian family. Its defenitely not a sheraton but in his way i think it is better Try drinking a bear or a gpas of vine in the garden. Defenitely wrth it

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent!"”
Reviews.Author: GraceJames
Reviews.Content: We had bought the hotel stay through Expedia's unpublished rates and was quite worried about the negative reviews of the hotel but it was a very delightful Rome experience. We enjoyed the breakfast every morning and it was surprising to see some ham/cheese/bread/cereal/fresh fruit/salad/ and the list goes on.. We even had a game of chess one night; we really enjoyed as if the place was our home. The metro was only 10 minute walk away from the hotel and quite safe even at night time. It was a good 15 minute walk from the Terminal Station which was also convenient. The front desk person was great help in arranging our last minute tour experience for the Vatican and the Sistine Chapel. We also brought out our morning coffee and enjoyed the Rome weather sitting in the patio just outside of the front entrance. We were given two single beds put together as one which was a bit weird for newlyweds but we had the most relaxing and the sweetest sleep in Rome. The decoration was very colourful paintings on walls with marble flooring in the common areas. The ceilings of the lobby and common areas are arched as if we were in some kind of cave which gave a little culture. If you are wanting to find a unique experience of Rome, I would definitely recommend you. I would definitely recommends my friends and family to stay here and will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Just stay away”
Reviews.Author: Hardee
Reviews.Content: I don't know if management posts funny reviews. I didn't like staying here and share all the bad reviews. You can hear the neighbours talk and the traffic outside. Maybe an OK hotel if you have severe hearing problems.

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls, unfriendly stuff”
Reviews.Author: emaxphotography
Reviews.Content: Walls a so thin, you can hear every noise!!! Personal is not really eager to help, however they do their job. In fact it is one or maximum 2 stars hotel! Nevertheless you pay tourist taxes as for a 4 star hotel. On the other hand it was a cheap option to stay, good location and though breakfast was bit boring, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Best place ever”
Reviews.Author: maxmix
Reviews.Content: We, me and my family, have been visiting rome and this hotel for the third time. We are swiss and we love to travel around italia with our vAn. I have told what i disliked this plac in the last resusumes but this time i have to point some features out. The place is nice, it's cheap and the service is splendid. What we noticed that it is inrpoving over the years. I dedicate this post to the kindness and dedication of the ovners. Go there try it. It's a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Should not be rated as 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: MSLaiWoo
Reviews.Content: The night staff is really rude and not helpful although the day manager was really helpful and good and gave us some tips on where to go for sightseeing. This hotel should be rated 3 Stars at best. The aircon was not working even though it was only Autumn. The bathroom and room was really small. Breakfast was ok but there was no wifi in the rooms. The location is quite central and quite near public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK but not for summer”
Reviews.Author: Birchgrovers
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as one of Expedia's mystery offers. It was promised as a 4 star hotel, but I think it would be lucky to rate a 3. The hotel was clean and there was a modern lift. The room and bathroom were an acceptable size for 2 for Rome; -small, but we have seen smaller. We were happy to get access to our room prior to the official check in time, and pleased to see breakfast and wi-fi included. There are some interesting pieces ofI furniture in the public areas. It's handy to transport; from the Airport Express train terminal, a 20 minutes walk, there's a little yellow train that stops near the hotel, or from the main station catch the green tram 5 or 14. (You could catch a taxi, but be prepared for a guided of Rome.) The hotel is in a mostly residential area that feels quite safe, and is about a 5-minute walk from the Metro. There are historical monuments and good restaurants within a short walk. The downsides? The a/c and ventilation were non-existent. We either had fresh air with the windows open - but disturbed sleep from the noise of the scooters and cars on the cobbled streets, or the room was hot and stuffy (this was late October) and sleep was again disturbed. The room looked tired, with holes in the carpet, lots of scuff marks on the walls, and a lot of black marks near the non-functioning a/c duct. The room safe was not attached to anything; it just sat it the cupboard. The breakfast eggs have more of a future in the Michelin factory than inside me. I'd stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: AlfCalgary
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Expedia as a 4 star hotel. It turns out to be a 2 star Mexican at best. When we arrived it didn't look very promising but as we had prepaid, through Expedia's Unpublished Rate Offers where you are not told the name of the Hotel until after you book and prepay (can not be cancelled and not refundable), we thought we would "tough it out". After viewing the "garden", lobby, breakfast area, elevator and our room, all of which are pretty bleak, we decided to try to get a room elsewhere and forfeit our payment. The Hotel is very old, dark, dusty, very eclectic with a mishmash of old furniture and accessaries and eccentric paintings. The elevator has room for one person and one bag and it is easier to drag your luggage up the steps. To begin with the room was a fire trap with iron barred windows, very poor furniture, a bed you would not want to sleep in, dirty looking, small, the air conditioning didn't work all topped off with a lovely portrait in oils over the the bed of a women with blood running down her face. Do not trust expedia's ratings and unless your desperate you may wish to pick another hotel. We ended up staying at the Bernini Bristol which was like entering into heaven after the Emona experience but at $400.00 + a night it was a little short of its price tag but a great location and good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms not great for three, and wi-fi signal poor”
Reviews.Author: sazh999
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in July. Before booking I had contacted the hotel to make sure they could accomodate us with a room for three people. We were assured this would be fine. However, on arrival, although the room was nicely decorated the door to the bathroom was just coloured glass with no curtain etc, completely unsuitable for three. On request our room was changed the next morning to one that was more suitable although this then became a tighter squeeze. The staff seemed to be a bit defensive but relaxed somewhat when they realised we were not argumentative. Breakfast was average. Although advertised as having wi-fi this was variable and very slow. The AC did not work at all well and this seemed to be a general complaint amongst other visitors - it was very hot at the time. Whilst I have made these negative comments, the hotel was in a good location for Rome. The decor was interesting although perhaps not to everyone's taste, the hotel were helpful with keeping baggage on our day of departure. There was a lovely garden area outside and a relaxing lobby area with access to a computer for guests.

Reviews.Title: “How stars from Trip Advisor are different in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: bhhenry81
Reviews.Content: Nicely appointed hotel in a quiet neighborhood a short walk from the Metro. Staff is friendly and breakfast is good. What I want to relate is that if you are from the USA and used to the star ratings you will need to adjust. Square footage in Rome makes you feel like you are in a miniature doll house. The rooms are tiny and what we might call Spartan. So when you think that Four Stars in the states is the same as in Rome you will find that the rating system is not the same. If you put that aside the hotel is quaint and attractive and the patio is a good place to have your morning coffee. If you like taking the bus it is a short ride from the Termini Railroad Station and you are dropped off at the corner a block away. Be aware that public transit is well used and at certain hours not many places on the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Great place.”
Reviews.Author: Margaretdunlop
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days in September. The hotel was spotless, the staff was very helpful, the room was quite large with twin beds, a sofa and a large en suite bath. The location was on the edge of central Rome but the proximity of the Termini and the subway stop was great and the buses were just around the corner . It was very easy to get to other parts of Rome for only a Euro per trip. There were lots of restaurants nearby. The view of the Aquaduct outside our bedroom window was nice. The breakfast was great and we were able to eat on the patio every morning. The air conditioning in our room did not work all the time but we were able to open the windows. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming 19th Century Converted Mansion”
Reviews.Author: BonnieN4
Reviews.Content: Purchased via the "hidden" until purchased feature and very pleased with choice for a 3 day stay. Lovely Italian mansion converted into a small hotel of 4 floors and owners accommodations. As it is a convert with a lot of original features maintained room size various greatly, ours was quite small (#18) but saw others that were 2 to 3 times larger (#10) some with verandas. The common areas are large, comfortable and eclectic, beautiful private garden space to unwind in, friendly staff and lovely owner. If you want to feel like you are a guest at an Italian country villa in the city then this is it, if you want the Hilton pay the price and go there. Rooms are clean but bathroom had some mold stains and ceiling water damage which appear to be from past guests not using the bathroom fans. Excellent location for starting your walk around Rome, close to street cars and metro, good restaurants, tavernas and grocery stores . Positive features Excellent quiet location, good neighborhood, varied and plentiful breakfast with good “American” coffee and extended times, gives the Italian experience and that home away from home feel, free access to computer/internet, bar fridge prices at supermarket rates, free secured parking (limited), lovely private and safe outdoor space, late night bar service, multifunctional shower features and bidet good for soaking feet at the end of a long day (lol), 2000 year old ruins right outside front gate. Friendly, knowledgeable and helpful staff. Negative features Beds are extremely firm, small (we requested twin) and pillows are pathetic, if not use to this the first 10 minutes each morning can be very painful to work the kinks out. Rooms appear to be aired out daily and air conditioning takes a great deal of time to bring the temp down so rooms never get really cold until early morning however prevailing winds, tile floors, marble and very high ceilings keep the rooms comfortable even without using the air ( at 28 C outside temp). No individual safes in room can leave valuables with front desk for safe keeping. Tons of TV channels but could not find any English ones needed to surf to find English shows with Italian subtitles (very limited). Room size varies from small (which is not unusual for Europe) to large so storage/dressers not guaranteed. Bacon is not cooked to crispy. Would definitely stay again but would expect to pay a variance according to room size.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: RevlonMarkham
Reviews.Content: We stayed for nine days in September and were very pleased with our choice..the location was great, close to the colosseum and some churches...staff very friendly and helpful...rooms were very nice and clean, breakfast was delicious and you had lots to choose from. Would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “This is a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diane G
Reviews.Content: Looked nothing from street, but soon as entered was lovely relaxing atmosphere, fountains, vines etc.just so good after long flight. Reception helpful, and knows as much as vistor centre. Room a bit small, but for this price in middle of Rome couldn't expect more. Lift efficent. Art deco collection, was interesting every where you looked. Breakfast very good, everything you could possibly want, fresh fruit salad. 10 mins walk to Coleseum, 15 to Termini station. Taxi to Tivoli Fountain cost us 7 euro. free wi-fi This is one of the great small hotels, I really love to stay in, with a personal friendly atmoshere.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, quite and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: MORREY
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Emona Aquaeductus in early June for three nights. We found the staff to be friendly and accommodating. It is only a few blocks walk down the road to the metro station and about twenty minutes walk to the train station, so location was fairly good. The suburb location meant that is was quite. We found the room to be a little on the small side. There was a nice patio garden at the hotel which was great to relax and enjoy a drink. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but some rude staff”
Reviews.Author: wandav00
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from the 6th July for 4 nights. The hotel is close to railway stn and shops. Colosseum is fairly nearby. Hotel was quite clean and quiet. Breakfast was also nice. The room was a bit small for 3 people but we managed. The staff were friendly except for one male on reception when we arrived on the afternoon of the 6th who was quite abrupt and rude. Not a nice welcome at all. All other encounters with him on other days were similarly unpleasant. Otherwise all was OK.

Reviews.Title: “We Liked it a Lot and will be back with friends!”
Reviews.Author: beejayel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Emona Aquaeductus for 3 nights in mid August 2011 and, being Europeans and therefore used to small rooms (we don't all have the space to build monstrous great hotels like in the US) so we were pretty much expecting what we got, which was a compact room with twin beds and en-suite facilities. The mini-bar was stocked and not checked - they took it on trust when we told them what we had used. Whilst not palatial, the room was perfectly adequate for what we needed i.e. a place to shower after. The rooms meet the most essential criterion in that they are clean and well kept. The breakfast is plentiful and well worth getting up for. Although it is a 15 min tram ride to the city rail terminal (where the metro lines cross each other) the No 19 tram offers a direct link to the Vatican, with only a 10 minute walk on arrival. The Colosseum is a 20 minute walk away. We will be returning with friends!

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Jogi85
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights in this hotel and can definitely recommend it. Relatively close to termini station so that's a pro (Manzoni metro station is closer). Definitely enjoyed the stay, arty small scale hotel. It has a very nice and relaxing garden terrace and a very friendly staff. Wlan was also included for free. Hotel rooms were nice and clean maybe walls could be a bit thicker. Also relatively easy to reach by car. Even parking in front of hotel is relatively cheap (4€ for 8h) and uncomplicated if you dont wanna go for the extra hotel parking (surchage of 20€ for 24h). Only downside was the breakfast was relatively minimal compared to other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very quaint and friendly”
Reviews.Author: BevyPoo
Reviews.Content: Staff was fantastic, very helpful with all questions and directions. Room was comfortable and clean. Breakfast was free of charge and had quite the selection that included scrambbled eggs and hot meat, unusual for an Italian hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great, affordable hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: pasip78
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at this lovely hotel for a weekend. Hotel was located in a quiet region of Rome, still only 15 min walk from Colosseum. We had a wonderful time in Rome and in this beautiful hotel. Room was very nice and comfortable, also quiet. Good breakfast, hospitality and kind service was excellent! I would recommend this hotel to everybody interested in goig to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you know the bus/metro routes.”
Reviews.Author: Yuki0917
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty good value for the price, only downside is that its far for the main attractions. (20min us ride to colosseum) --Pros-- -good breakfast buffet -relatively clean, and each room is different - there is a elevator but only fits 1person with luggage -extremely helpful Staff always willing to help and can speak English. We were greeted with a map and bus numbers for must see locations. -easy to get to/from train station via the tram. You just buy a ticket from a newspaper stand. 1euro a trip, or 4euro all day bus/metro pass. --Cons-- - too far from everything -the metro stops early (it was either 9pm or 10pm) so you can't really stay out too late. Otherwise you would have to take a nightbus home. The walk from the closest metro station is a good 8minutes Our highlight was the self serve included buffet breakfast in the morning. You can choose scrambled, bacon, toast, cereal, salami, cheese, ham, yoghurt, sweet pastries, cookies, coffee, and a variety of teas. We would only recommend this hotel if you've been to Rome before and are good with commuting. The service is good, and the rooms are relatively clean. Keep in mind that the rooms are all different, I looked at the photos and my room didn't have a fancy bathtub, we had a simple shower with bedit beside it. Our room was a good size for European hotels. There are mosquitoes so bring some bug repellant. We noticed squashed bugs on our ceiling haha Otherwise, if it's your first time, pick somewhere central (like near piazza navona or trevi fountain. Lots to see around there and you can stay out late to enjoy the beautiful city by night. It's a bit more expensive, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “It is NOT a four star”
Reviews.Author: Sonarcap
Reviews.Content: My trip to Rome started out with a few personal days at the Waldorf Astoria (a hilton property) outside city center north of Vatican City. I had to move to city center for business. I booled this property thru Expedia. It was advertised as a 4 star near city center. It was very far from city centrer. It was dirty. The rooms were small. The furniture was cheap. The mattresses and pillows were thin. The pictures were deceptive. It is NOT a four star property. My wife and I looked at three rooms and decided we could not stay there. I moved to a Best Western Globus near the University for a night...it was much better. Then I moved to where my business partners were staying Hotel Ponte Sisto (a true four star hotel). There was no comparison. Hotel Emona Aquaeductus and Expedia are NOT being honest. Emona Aquaeductus is no better than 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and Miss”
Reviews.Author: jfm1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first week of June 2011. On the positive side, the hotel is conveniently located near central Rome, which means that you can walk to a lot of the attractions in central Rome. There are several restaurants in the area that have reasonable prices. The staff is quite friendly. The hotel is quite clean and feels safe. On the negative side, the hotel rooms range from tolerably small to intolerably small. The room we had for the first night of our stay was far too small for two people. The room had too much furniture. The shower for this room did not work properly and sprayed water all over the bathroom. The air conditioner barely kept the room cool. Management gave us a much better room for the last three nights of our stay. Again, there were some maintenance issues--a missing drain plug for the bathroom sink, inadequate air conditioning, and a shower head that, unless directed carefully, sprayed water all over the bathroom. The missing drain plug should have been easy to fix but never got fixed. The air conditioner only had one operable fan speed and was barely able to keep the room cool (and we had fine, mild weather). This hotel is not a "vacation wrecker." With some more attention to maintenance, this could become a very nice place to stay. My recommendation, if you want to stay in this hotel, is to check your room out first before you pay with your credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointing!”
Reviews.Author: saffas
Reviews.Content: We took a risk and booked one of those "special anonymous deals". The headline being something like "4 star central Rome hotel" and it turned out to be neither! The hotel is on the outskirts of central Rome, 200m further east and it would not be in central Rome. It is a 10min walk from the Metro and the only main attraction that is within a 30 min walk is the Colosseum. The average breakfast is only served from 07.30am which we felt was too late as we were keen to get to the main attractions early to avoid the queues. So we either skipped it or grabbed something on our way out. Our room was tiny, considering how much we paid! The bedding and decor were old and tired and our aircon did not work properly. The walls are also very thin and with the room being near the elevator we constantly woke up to it opening and closing. The neighbourhood is not the best either. On our way back to the hotel from dinner one night my wife and I were stopped and searched by the police who were apparently looking for 2 drug dealers and suspected we may have bought drugs from them. Not a great experience! We also found the area quite noisy. The only reason this hotel gets 2 out of five and not 1 is because Andrea was extremely helpful and polite and they served complimentary snacks and wine one evening which meant we saved on dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel but left disappointed”
Reviews.Author: rachius
Reviews.Content: Decent rooms, good breakfast and cosy terrace. The wi-fi signal was too weak and we were only on the first floor. Close to Colloseum but quite far from other popular spots. We didn't mind this though as we enjoyed walking as the weather was favourable. Staff was quite helpful with the exception of the blond woman who was pretty hostile. We forgot the key for the safe (which we never requested) in the room when we checked out, the taxi was waiting for us and while we were busy carrying luggage, stroller and toddler she was huffing and puffing about the key we didn't bring to the front desk. This unfortunately left us with a bad taste in our mouth, it felt like she no longer had to pretend to be service-minded once we were leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Stay in Rome with Teenagers”
Reviews.Author: Corckp1020
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. Close to the Coluseum and Forum and 3 blocks from the Metro, this is a great and ecletic place to stay. Andrea and team do an outstanding job making you feel welcome. The room we were in had 2 bedrooms and a small bathroom but we didn't feel cramped. Breakfast was great and the mixed style of paintings, art and decor made it a unique experience.

Reviews.Title: “Staff, Breakfast & the courtyard make this hotel outstanding”
Reviews.Author: wooleyoneeye
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night at the hotel as we were going on a cruise the next day. The staff was very accomodating as we arrived early and they let us in our room early, which was very nice after travelling for 20 hours. The courtyard was beautiful & quiet with Nero the cat for company. We asked for coffee and the hotel staff made us some at one in the afternoon after we had checked in and freshened up. The room was small, but quaint. The front desk staff helped us arrange private transportation to the pier so that we could get on our cruise the next day. We found the hotel very quiet at night as we were exhausted and in bed very early that night. Breakfast was one of the best I have had in Europe, with real eggs, crisp bacon, something nearly impossible to find in Italy, and fruit salad that was excellent. It of course had other selections, but none of us really noticed as the rest was so good. The only down fall of this hotel is they have to fix their lift. I would stay here again and was dissappointed along with everyone else in my family, that we did not stay here when we got back from the cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, handy to train station”
Reviews.Author: RozKiwi
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff here are very friendly and helpful. The hotel is quiet and while the rooms are small they are clean and well appointed. Free wi-fi in the rooms worked well. I walked from the train station with my luggage (in a backpack despite being a business traveller these days).

Reviews.Title: “Value for money basic but quirky hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1110
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed here for 4nights - we were given a room on the 3rd floor - and there was no working lift!! I dont pack light, so i had a big case, and so did my partner. Thankfully we're a young couple so we were ok to carry it all up three flights of stairs (by we i mean my bf!) but an elderly couple really would have struggled. The room was really small, there was just about enough room to walk around the edge of the bed - and the bathroom was also tiny. That was our main gripe. Other than that, the aircon worked well, and it was clean. Unfortunately we also had a gigantic painting on the entire side of one wall - two skinny dogs fighting with their ribs showing...it was so awful... i almost asked to change rooms purely to get away from the painting. Breakfast was served in a lovely little room, the best feature of this hotel is its style and architecture. There's 1950's furtniture and fittings here and there and gorgeous marble. It was basic, but good quality and definately adequate considering the price. We had no safe, however reception put our passports and money into their safe - which i was worried about...especially as they wouldnt give me a receipt for how much cash id just given them! But ayway - it worked out fine. I think we possibly got a raw deal on our room, and if it wasnt for the size of it and the awful painting i would be singing its praises all the way - as it was, i left thinking it was "satisfactory". Side notes - there are about 6 restuarants really close by, we ate out each night and had a lovely meal every time. Its very italian and not so touristy, which i liked. The subway - main line one - Marzonie? something like that, is about 10minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise and warm greeting”
Reviews.Author: RobertoDG
Reviews.Content: My son (22) and I (64) spent a month in Italy this past May. We started off in Rome where we stayed for 3 nights at the Emona. The hotel is tucked away in a quiet residential area. There was a bit of noise during the day on account of the new elevator being installed, otherwise we slept soundly. The room was typically Italian small, but it was spotless with a new modern bathroom. We were warmly greeted and made to feel welcome at all times. The buffet breakfast was plentiful with plenty of selection. We had use of the free internet -- a bonus as we were to learn later since many other hotels charged for the service. The subway stop is only about three blocks away. It's a nice stroll down a quiet residential street -- very convenient. I will definitely return to the Emona on my next trip to Rome. Ideal for anyone looking for a quiet relaxing stay at night. No nightlife in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: whims2006
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my hubby in the period from Feb 27 to March 8, 2010. Very clean hotel with good breakfasts(cereals, milk, juice, scrambled eggs+bacon, toast,jam,butter, fruits, sausages,yoghurts, fruit desserts,pastry) ,free of charge 24h/7 internet on the ground floor where reception is , helpful personnel. Our room was located on the second floor with the terrace.Room is well furnished, not big but it can house suitcases, linen is changed every day or every other day. Noisy street but we got used to it some days later. I can recommend a restaurant nearby named Santa Croce(Saint Cross):very tasty pizza and second dishes are very good as well. On the way to Termini (where trams go) you can pop in to ice-cream factory Palazzio del Fredo, the oldest ice-cream factory since 1865(via Principe Eugenio, 65):delicious ice-cream and even ice-cream tarts! best regards, Natalia and Andrey Korolevs, Moscow, Russia

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: paul777
Reviews.Content: This is a good budget hotel in Rome. The staff is helpful and willing to accommodate guests. Location is good--very close to buses and trams connceting to Termini and Colosseum. Metro is about 10 min away. Breakfast could be improved--it could have more variety and make sure that all choices are available during the specified serving time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelsilva
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at Emona hotel for 4 nights with my girlfirend. The staff were very friendly and helpful everytime and they are serving a great breakfast . The hotel is located 5 minutes walk from the manzoni metro station from where you can easily reach to the city center. There is a bus and tram stop 20 seconds away from the hotel where you can reach to the center easily. There is also a free computer and board games at the lobby. Everything makes you feel like home and hotel is really incredible for the value.If i go to rome again i surely stay at Emona and I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “I would have rather stayed at a Motel6”
Reviews.Author: Cosmosuncle
Reviews.Content: Let me start by listing the good attributes of this hotel. 1. Friendly, Multi-lingual employees. 2. 2 Block walk from the subway - 15 walk to the Colosseum 3. Free Wi-Fi 4. Free breakfast from 7-10AM Now on to the review: During my trip to Europe this month I learned what makes a hotel great. There are only really three things, if you're a minimalist, that you will need. 1. Good bed 2. Quiet rooms 3. Working, Clean bathrooms. Sure, one could complain about the view from the window, the neighborhood dogs barking outside, or the interior design in a hotel, but all a minimalist needs is a good bed to sleep in, minimal auditory disturbances, and a working bathroom. I hear that many hotels in Europe consider a double-bed and 2 single beds pushed together as the same thing. The room we stayed in had 2 single beds pushed together. It wasn't a huge problem...It's common sense that if a big guy tries to lay next to his girlfriend on two single beds with wheels on a wood floor, the beds will move apart and he will find his shoulder and arm halfway through the gap. I understood this and the fact that it meant that my girlfriend and I couldn't cuddle. The problem with the beds was that they were lumpy, which is terrible for someone with a bad back, and loud. Every time I uselessly rolled over to get comfortable, the bed would make loud, cracking sounds. I don't know if it was the springs in the bed or if it was the frame but the sounds were so loud that it would wake us up from any sleep that we attempted. I say that we "attempted" to sleep because it was too loud in the hotel. I'm not sure how most 3 star hotels are in Europe but this one was bustling with noise. It may be unfair to say that the whole hotel was loud because we were put on the first floor above the entrance and could hear the patrons coming in and out, but several guest could be heard walking through the hotel hallways talking to each other in loud voices...or at least they sounded loud. I know the hotel can't make noise restrictions like they do in hostels but they can do something about the thin walls and windows. Me and my girlfriend have differing opinions of the bathroom. I found the mold growing in between the tiles and on the paint around the ceiling unsettling...the hotel has daily maid service and yet, they don't pay attention to the details that really matter. I really feel like a 3 star hotel should be better than my bathroom at home. The shower was stand-up and had a sliding door track that wasn't properly sealed with caulk so that when one took a shower, water would spill out and puddle near near the door...or soak the towel you put down to stand on. When we realized this, we rolled up the towels and pressed them into the gap between the floor and the track and this fixed it. The shower doors looked relatively new, and as maid service came in every day, this should have been an issue that they should have taken notice of and fixed. The second, and last, day that we spent here started with a fire alarm at 8am (which is terrible when you don't get a good nights' sleep), and no hot water for our shower. So apparently, that problem hasn't been addressed yet. Overall...If you don't care about the 3 things I mentioned above..a good bed, quiet rooms and clean bathrooms, it's a nice hotel. The people are friendly and speak English, Free Wi-Fi is awesome, and it looks like, from the other reviews, that the breakfast is really good.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, but”
Reviews.Author: sydneymax
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for several nights during a trip to Rome in early Oct 2009. Had a single room with ensuite. The room and bathroom were always clean, and serviced daily. The single room however was tiny. My backpack went on the floor, leaving no room to even walk around the bed. The bed was hard and uncomfortable, and the curtains were almost non-existant. There was no way that the room would ever get dark, especially with the hotel lights on all night directly outside the window. (I had to sleep with en eye patch!) There was an outside shutter, but it had seized shut and could not be moved. The breakfasts each morning were great. Cereals and breads along with bacon and eggs, plus juices and tea and coffee. A great way to start a sight seeing day. All in all the hotel is fine. The hard uncomfortable bed and lack of proper curtains were the only draw backs.

Reviews.Title: “Value hotel with some hot water issues”
Reviews.Author: bcsystems
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel. It is located two subway stops southeast of the central train station. It is not really close to any of the major attractions except for San Giovonni. However, the hotel is close to major bus/tram stop and 5 minute walk to the subway station. The hotel entrance has a nice garden with a sitting area. Inside, it is nicely decorated with a decent size lobby and a dining area. Breakfast is free with freshly cooked bacon, eggs, and tomatoes. They have some cold cuts and cheese. There is also the usual assortment of continental breakfast items. I asked for a larger room and was given a nice size room with a small sofa and desk. The bed was solid and comfortable. The bathroom was very big though the only problem was there is no shower curtain. You shower in the tub and the bathroom can get quiet wet from the spray. The problems I had with this place were the hot water and poor water pressure. On the first day, the hotel said it was the boiler. While the next three days, it did get progressively better, I honestly do not believe it was a boiler problem. My room was the last corner room on the second floor. I just think being an old building; it just had poor water pressure. You turn on the hot water for about 5 minutes, it eventually comes though not very strong. The other problem was internet access. While each room had free Ethernet jack access, for whatever reason, it stopped working after using it for about an hour on our first day. No one was ever able to figure out the problem. They do have a desktop in the lobby for free internet access. You can also buy WIFI access. In general, we were happy with this place except for the hot water situation. The price was good for the property and the free breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location and full of mosquitos”
Reviews.Author: Nibnib
Reviews.Content: I can't say I was that I was overly impressed. The staff weren't as helpful or friendly as the previous reviews I read. Breakfast is served at 7:30, but they were never ready throughout our 5 night stay. You were waiting until 8:30 for all the food to be out. Because of all the water features near the entrance, the hotel was brimming with mosquitos. So I had to resort to spraying mozzie spray all over myself before going down for breakfast. We had problems getting hot water in the shower. The air conditioning was not very good. It got too cold at night and there weren't any extra blankets. TV reception was terrible and the remote buttons were worn and some did not work. The hotel wasn't badly located from the tram, metro or buses, and was in a quiet area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for Rome”
Reviews.Author: clampfam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in June for 4 nights, couldn't fault it. 15 mins walk from Termini ( did look at some hotels on internet around Termini & so glad I didn't book one, very noisy & not such a nice neighborhood) The hotel is only 20 min walk to Colosseum, from there you can explore most of the major sightseeing attractions. We didn't use public transport as we enjoy walking. The room was basic, but tastefully decorated with paintings & nice high ceilings & very clean, with fresh towels everyday & fresh bed linen after 2 days.a fridge & air conditioning, which you do need if traveling in the summer months, TV had loads of channels but only CNN in English, but for all the time your in the room, this was fine. The outside courtyard was a delight to sit in after a full days sightseeing we would buy some wine on the walk home & sit outside. Breakfast was continental but adequate to set you up for the day, hot coffee, toast, pastries, yogurts, bread, cold meats etc. Even scrambled eggs & bacon if you didn't go down too late.Overall great budget hotel, in a nice quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL Baton Rouge La.”
Reviews.Author: CASSEYMAE
Reviews.Content: The Emona was a great place to stay and the staff was very helpful and were like our family away from home. They went out of their way the make sure we were taken care of and were eager to help with our travel out of Rome for our side trips. I would stay here again and would reccoment this hotel to anyone. Our room was clean and well kept every day. the bus system was wonderful and easy to use. We had a frig in our room which was well stock with drinks. Stay you will be well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: linziloo2009
Reviews.Content: We had read all the reviews on this site about the hotel so knew it was going to be fairly good but it was even better than we imagined. The outside of the hotel was lovely and close to the Manzoni metro stop (you have to walk down one leafy residential road). The front courtyard was very cute. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful (and spoke excellent english) The room was lovely, i suppose it may seem on the small side to some but it was great for us. It was very clean and was cleaned every day. The bathroom was gorgeous. We had a room that was facing the back (23) and had no noise to disturb us, if you opened the window you could hear the traffic but when closed it was silent. The room was airconditioned, had a tv and a fridge stocked with alcohol and soft drinks(not badly priced either) It would have been even better if they had included a kettle and some tea/coffee but im not sure if you should expect this in a 3 star. Breakfast was really good there was the usual continental selection and bacon and eggs! The coffee was excellent! The breakfast was on for a good amount of time (7.30-10am) which would suit anyones routine i would have thought. I felt very secure in this hotel as the front gate was locked and you had to be buzzed in. There was some work being done to the hotel when we were there but apart from the evidence of tools etc there was never any noise or disruption while we were in (maybe they did it during the day when most people would be out but generally we didnt go out till after 10am and there was no noise up to then) This hotel far exceeded expectations and i would recommend it to anyone. i believe they have an interconnecting room aswell so that would be perfect if we went back with our three children. Having a nice hotel makes a holiday even if you just use it as a base, having somewhere nice to come back to with staff that are plentiful and helpful just makes it perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as photo”
Reviews.Author: maobee
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Rome last September to celebrate his birthday. We did a lot of research and finally decided to stay at Emona based on the positive reviews and the photos and info on the hotel website. However, we were quite disappointed. Prior to our stay, I wrote to the email as shown on the website and explained the purpose of our stay and asked if we could have something extra and I was ready to pay. Here's a part of what I wrote to them - "I'd like to see if it is possible to have a nicer room for us, maybe a room with a better view or more romantic kind of decor? I would really appreciate any sort of support as I really want to make this birthday special for him and for us. Also, does your hotel sell chocolate cakes? I'm trying to see if I can get him some in the hotel, or near the hotel." Unfortunately, I did not hear anything at all from the hotel. There was no reply. I would understand if the hotel told me they couldn't do anything, I was really looking forward to a reply, especially after the nice comments regarding customer service that I'd read. I didn't get any. The room was the biggest disappointment - they gave us a room on the ground floor. The room was nothing like what you see on the website. It was dark and really basic. As our room faced the entrance, it was bright outside at night as well and we didn't feel all that comfortable even with the curtains, if they were considered proper at all. The shower was a bit funny as well, it was really hot for one second then cold the other. The room was certainly overpriced. Location wise it wasn't that big a problem for us though as we enjoyed walking around to see the city. It wasn't all that far from the nearest subway station anyway. The breakfast and the lounge were both OK as well. Enoma is suitable for single travellers not looking for a "nice stay" but a simple one with minimal facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great good value choice for Rome”
Reviews.Author: SilvAndNick
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the hotel. We booked a superior room but for the first night they only had a standard room. Not to worry though, on the second day they moved all our stuff to our new room. I can definetely recommend the superior room option. This is a great choice for a cheaper hotel in Rome. Breakfast is very good and the interior of the hotel has recently been refurbished. Location wise it's Ok, the neighbourhood it is in is a bit boring, but the nearest metro station is only 5 minutes walk away and the Colesseum an easy 15 minute stroll. Very recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Emona Aquaeductus”
Reviews.Author: Christina83
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in this hotel and we had a great time. The staff was very helpful and friendly and gave us the best advice and information for the area. The room was very clean and we had a beautiful view from our window. The room service was excellent, too. The breakfast, also, was not very big but offered a variety of products. The internet access is free. The only problem is that the hotel hasn't an elavator, so you must carry your things if you are given a room upstairs. And finally if I had to give one advice to the owner and the staff , would be to renovate the external of the building as it has some damages and destroys the external view of this beautiful villa. Generally, the hotel is close to the center, as it has the main train station and a metro station nearby, but far from the noice and the crowds of tourists. It is a very good choice. Try the restaurant which is few metres from the hotel at the same street. It's food is delicious!

Reviews.Title: “What a Find”
Reviews.Author: cobnarowl
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in a quiet part of Rome.Only 10 min from the station and 5 to the Metro.Easy walk to all the main sites especially the Rome Cathedral Modern rooms with lovely bathroom.Also a very filling breakfast to start the day

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ellielah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Emona in April for 4 night with my partner and I loved it! It is a pleasant 10min walk from the Colosseum, which didn't bother me at all, infact I liked the walk as it gave us a chance to see the city! The rooms were very clean, and the staff were very helpful! We arrived at 2am and there was someone around to welcome us and help us with our bags. I don't have one complaint about the hotel, i'm going back to Rome in November and will defiantly be staying here again! Ellie

Reviews.Title: “Pretty but boring location”
Reviews.Author: budge185
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend over the Easter weekend and thought the hotel was really nice. The rooms are a good size, although the twin beds are really close together (but most European hotels tend to be like that). The staff were friendly and helpful when we struggled with our basic Italian, and allowed early check-in on the day we arrived and let us leave our luggage there on the day we checked out so we could do some last-minute sight-seeing. Continental breakfast was included in our rate and it was really tasty, a good selection. The only thing I'd say is that the location was a bit quiet for me. It was about a 5 minute walk from the nearest subway station (Manzoni), although I think you can also take a bus or tram from Rome's main Termini Station. There were a handful of restaurants in the surrounding streets but not much choice. However, I have to add that many shops etc were closed because it was Easter, so it might be a bit livelier at other times.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best location”
Reviews.Author: 737wendy
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this is most definitely not a three star hotel - more like a one star. This hotel is situated on a main road and the noise from the traffic at night was almost intolerable. The hotel is tired, both internally and externally, and is in need of 'tidying up'. It was however, very cheap and the reception staff were very cheerful. Would I recommend this hotel to friends and family? - definitely not. For a few more pounds there are several hotels in the next street which are situated where it would be possible to sleep at night. After a long day walking in Rome, a night's sleep is needed more than anything. The breakfast was merely a token, which was better than nothing at all. The best thing about this hotel was the shower, powerful and hot and well received.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a hike from major attractions, but good value.”
Reviews.Author: MikeLoveToTravel
Reviews.Content: It's not a super fancy hotel, but it is a good value for the money. Clean hotel, big difference it looks like between the more expensive rooms and the cheaper one we got. But overall, not a bad place. However, it's a 30 min walk to the old part of town (Pantheon etc). For us it was fine since we were not really there to see those things again. Giving it 4 stars based on value.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable hotel”
Reviews.Author: jkbramer
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just got back from a week in Rome (11/17-11/24), and had stayed at the Hotel Emona Aquaeductus. Overall, we found this to be a pleasant experience. The room that we stayed in (26) had nice high ceilings and warm furnishings. It was pretty standard in size for a European hotel, the but the high ceilings made the space feel larger than it was. A few areas in the hotel could use a touch of plaster and fresh paint, but it didn't look run down at all. The walls were a bit on the thin side, so you may have a few issues in the morning if you have noisy neighbors. (But why are you sleeping anyway -- you are in Rome?) The street noise was very minimal. The bed itself was a bit firm, but I was fine with that and slept like the dead (although perhaps walking the city non-stop had something to do with that). The bathroom was well-appointed as well, although the shower stall was on the small side, and the door was awkwardly placed by the toilet, so when you opened it, it would hit the bowl of the toilet. One's knees would hit the shower door as well while sitting on the toilet. It was definitely on the cozy side. They really should have scrapped the bidet to make more room. The location was really convenient -- just a few minute walk from the Manzoni train station (along the A train, which heads through Termini towards Piazza di Spagna). There is a tobacco shop on the way (with a pleasant clerk), so you can buy transport tickets here if you don't have close to exact change (the machines in the stations limit the change back to 2 Euro). The staff at the hotel really made the experience. They were all very friendly, and would greet you with a warm smile. The maid even changed out our bedspread on a daily basis, to give a bit of new design to the room (some of the bedspreads are quite vibrant and fun). When we found out that our departing flight took off too early to take the trains, they arranged a car for us (a new E-Class Mercedes, so not bad), so we were able to get to the airport stress-free in plenty of time. The hotel had a breakfast daily as well -- mostly pastries, cereal, meat, cheese, juice, and coffee. It was more than enough to get us going each day. Overall, I would say that this hotel exceeded my expectations. Sure, it wasn't perfect, but especially when you consider the cost, you will find this to be a spectacular value and cozy place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Conveinant Location”
Reviews.Author: WorcestershireSatnav
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 nights at the Emona and were pleasantly surprised by the hotel standard given the location (15 minute walk from the termini). Although the room was on the small side it accomodated a queen size bed!, the shower was excellent, towels changed daily. Breakfast is taken in a pleasant room in the basement . The staff are helpful, the big downside of this hotel is there is no lift so you need to be fit and able! With regard to local transport the bus/tram local terminus is 200yds/metres away with the Manzini metro stop 5/10 min walk. Excellent restaurant 100yards away towards the bus terminus, don't be put off by the empty appearence the action is all downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: DavidBLondon
Reviews.Content: (Booked via Lastminute.com) As others have said, what makes this hotel so good is the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff, and the only thing that stops me giving it five stars is that rooms are relatively small (at least for three people) and those at the front of the hotel are rather noisy at night due to being next to Via Statalia - a cobblestoned road that the local drivers race along. If you're a light sleeper (like me) ask for a quiet room at the back away from the road - which is where we moved after the first couple of nights. Going back to the positive, the hotel breakfast is very good, we found we would last through until 2pm or later before needing lunch despite walking almost continuously from 9am. The hotel is within quite easy walking distance of the Coloseum, the Forumand the Palatini. Indeed if you want you can walk to most places, but with public transport in Rome being very cheap (€4 for an adult all-day pass), you don't need to. Though the nearest Metro station (Manzoni) is currently closed for refurbishment, San Giovan is on the same line and not too far away. The train station is a short tram, bus or taxi ride away (or a long one, if you get on the wrong bus - which we did from time to time) so day trips to other cities by fast, reliable and relatively cheap Italian train are practical. Finally, right outside the hotel is the aquaduct that supplied the Palatine hill with water - nice to have a monument almost literally on your doorstep!

Reviews.Title: “Could NOT have found a better place!”
Reviews.Author: corknutz
Reviews.Content: This little hotel was just what i was hoping for. -The room was cute and comfortable with a large clean bathroom and had a small balcony with a view of the old aquaduct. So relaxing when you come home to rest your feet. -The staff was very friendly and helpful, they informed us of the best pizza place ever just around the corner and loaned us an umbrella the day it rained. -The breakfast and COFFEE were delicious. The only surprise was the the manzione metro station was closed however the two other stops were still very close . Overall I had a great experience at this hotel I would definatly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to many things”
Reviews.Author: birdtown
Reviews.Content: We booked a three star hotel on hotwire, and the Emona was just what we expected. Nothing extraordinary, but clean and good service from the staff. Our room was air conditioned, and they had a great breakfast. Rome itself is very dirty and not super easy to get around on public transport as there is rampant pickpocketing and many crowds. Someone was pawing at my wife's camera. The neighborhood had some good restaurants nearby, but it is otherwise a little dirty and away from much of the tourist activities. It is only a short walk to the colleseum and from there to many other great neighborhoods. The buses and trolleys run nearby very frequently, so if you dare, you can get anywhere you want to. I would definitely recommend the neighborhood of Trestavere for a good meal. Get out and walk into the streets a couple of blocks for some good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Billy260273
Reviews.Content: would say a couple of things, (i) is is in a crummy part of town (although reasonably central) (ii) rooms are very hit and miss....we were initially put in a small, dirty-ish room, but after one night we were moved to a nicer larger room. (iii) reception was fairly helpful (iv) there is no elevator, which is annoying if you arrive tired and have to bring bags up three flights. (v) reception area could do with a lick of paint not the worst, but i don't think it is good value.

Reviews.Title: “an amazing human story...”
Reviews.Author: jopken
Reviews.Content: i was with my daughter in Rome and was robbed the first day, my wallet was stolen on arrival. i had nothing left, no cash, no banccards, no id, nothing... I was in Rome to celebrate my daughter's Communion... Andrea takes care of the lobby...what this man did for me and my girl is amazing. i still have trouble to believe it... since it was a christion holiday-weekend (easter) Western Union was closed so i could not transfer money. Andrea searched for hours on saturday, sunday, monday to find a solution...he gave me from his personal money so i could go out with my girl... i had to wait until tuesday morning to be able to get the money transferred... but since i had no ID the transfer had to be done on someone who could legitimate.....Andrea again...he left his his lobby and went with me to catch the money... this man rescued my holiday. this man still has a heart. and it is in the right place. thank you with all my heart Andrea, especially in the name of my daughter. May Roma win every Champions League to come Johan en Hanne Vanderschuren

Reviews.Title: “I'll be going back!”
Reviews.Author: ScenicSoul
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as part of a last minute package and got lucky. When I arrived in Rome, my luggage was lost. The man at the front desk was really helpful and even made a couple of calls for me. As soon as my luggage arrived, I was called to the front desk. My room (#25) was cozy with a nice bathroom (no bath, just a shower) and faced the back of the property so it was super quiet. There was a mini-fridge and plenty of space to hang/put my clothes. It's a nice residential neighborhood and I never felt unsafe walking alone from the Metro (about a 10 minute walk) even at night. Breakfast was a self serve buffet with not a huge selection but enough to eat and a nice selection of teas. Over my 6 day stay the staff was always very helpful and warm. They gave me suggestions on which tour to take and the woman who checked me out even waived the few Euros I owed for using the phone. I hope to go back someday!

Reviews.Title: “Return of Mislaid Keys”
Reviews.Author: irish Holly
Reviews.Content: Really a lovely hotel. Very secure and near all public Transport. Has an old world feel about it and was kept immaculately clean. No trouble with communication as the staff all could speak English. Really lived up to expectations and would visit it again. Left my car Keys behind and they were posted to Ireland promptly. Many thanks.

Reviews.Title: “a great base for exploring”
Reviews.Author: lovebugs04
Reviews.Content: Our welcome at 1am was warm and friendly, the room clean and tidy and a bottle of champagne and fresh flowers awaited us. We only stayed for a three night honeymoon so as we were going for an intensive exploration of Rome we were quite happy that breakfast is the only meal served! There is a supermarket not far from the hotel as well as a 24 hour snack bar for those who are desperate, but nothing offered after 10.30am in the hotel. We stayed in Room 28 with a great view of the aqueduct and have no complaints about the service and the helpfulness of the staff. Our only problem is that being at the front of the hotel means traffic noise from early in the morning can give light sleepers a rude awakening!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: gerg_861
Reviews.Content: When we arrived it was 38 degrees outside, and we were dusty and tired. However upon reaching our hotel the receptionist was very pleasant and led us straight to our room. (I don't recall the number but it was the room on the right side of the hall on the same floor as reception) When we entered we were greeted by a rush of invigoratingly cool air and delighted to see how large the room was, even containing a full sized sofa. The bathroom was in very good repair, and featured a whirlpool (which I used every day), bidet and very large mirror with good lighting. The only complaint that I might have about our room was that the airconditioning was slightly noisy. Being quite young and fit I found the location to be ideal, allowing easy access by foot in less than 10 minutes to San Giovanni in Laterno and around 15 minutes to both the Colosseum and the Baths of Caracalla. The complimentary breakfast was quite filling, and the changing fruit selection was especially nice. The area is a little short on restaurants, but the La Pecora Pazza restaurant that is quite near at 35 via Statilia served enormous portions and was filled with locals when we went there. I would (and have) recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way”
Reviews.Author: jen2pies
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 'dreaded' room 20 mentioned in other reviews, but we loved it. It is a disabled room but that was great for three girls (e.g. more room to move about, big shower, didn't need a bath). I would recommend it but, be warned, it is a long walk into the centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Emona”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I and three other friends stayed at the Emona for twenty one days. March 1, to March 21, 2006. It was quite an enjoyable experience. The staff could not have been more helpful and friendly, always giving us tips on outings, places to eat, and ways to travel. We were very comfortable, it was very clean, and the breakfast was good and filling. I will certainly stay there again if I go back. We could catch the bus right around the corner. There was also a lovely place to have dinner close by and a pizza shop for a late night snack. I would recommend this hotel to my family and friends. Most of the staff spoke english quite well.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: filthiestfish
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located approx 10 minutes from the nearest Metro station which is Manzini and in a not-so-good area which although safe to walk through, is covered in graffiti and rubbish which makes it an unappealing sight! The area is also marked by the presence of beggars which you should avoid. I stayed with my parents for a total of 10 days at this hotel and it turned out to be a complete disaster which spoilt our enjoyment of the city. As soon as we arrived we knew that our stay was going to be a challenging one-for starters the outside of the hotel looked really old and grotty. As we stepped inside we could hear the loud noise of drilling going on-essential maintenance work taking place during peak season? We were met at reception by a young man called Andreas who briskly gave us the keys to room 20. This room is on the far end of the ground floor and as it turns out is suitable for disabled visitors & so because it is a bit more spacious, it was given to us as a "triple room". We found so many problems with this room though! Although the hotel is undergoing a refurbishment programme, room 20 has yet to undergo the transformation and therefore looks ancient. Here is our list of problems: The walls had cracks everywhere (see pic) we had a standing lamp which was either not working or needed bulb replacing No bedside tables so everything had to be placed on the floor Television set-every channel had a grainy picture and only English channel was CNN and this had very bad picture quality Floor not cleaned often so dirt accumulated over days & towels not regularly changed Bathroom mirror had cracks in 3 places-whats that about 7 years of bad luck?! Shower curtain was being held with a rope! Toilet was too low because its suitable for disabled No bath or bidet The shower handle was broken and kept coming off when we turned it on! We hastily complained to Andreas about our issues but were told that we would have to wait until the manager was around as there was nothing he could do. Eventually, after much protesting, we were moved to room 14, also on ground floor . This was a marked improvement as it had a good shower and bidet and the television was in working order. However the room is located right next to reception which meant that there was much talking and phone ringing and loud entrance buzzer noises keeping us awake throughout the night! On the second day, we were awoken at 8am with the sound of drilling-yep! work being carried out at 8am! Where is the common sense I ask! The room was never cleaned during our duration and we found dustballs under the bed so it seems like they only take care of the superficial aspect of cleaning. BREAKFAST-this was very basic and economical, and in our opinion non acceptable for a so called 3* hotel. The bread was prepacked sliced of poor quality; the cheese was spread-so no sight of real cheese then. Cold meats came from packets, and cheap tasting orange juice as well as coffee from machine. On some days if we were lucky we would get fresh fruit. Of what there was, it was not enough, as we found very little ham, salami and bread so when it was gone,it would take ages to be refilled. What concerned us the most was the low spirits of the housemaid and general sombre mood of the place. On one occasion we saw the maid get angry with guests who-God forbid!-had asked for more food to be put on the table as there was nothing! After one week we left for a 3 day trip to Venice which was amazing (we stayed at the Ca Formenta Hotel which is also 3* but absolutely brilliant & worth 4*-management of Emona please take note!!!) but had prebooked a return to Emona for a further 3 days, so with much trepidation left some of our bags at reception. We arrived back at Emona at almost midnight, but had informed reception of our arrival time beforehand, so you would think that they would avoid a repetition of our first visit but-what do you know!-once again we were handed the keys to room 20!!! This made us frustrated because Andreas had deliberately saved the worst room in the hotel for us with the excuse that it was the last one-what a shabby excuse. We were treated really poorly-he was patronising to us, rude & intimidating, & when challenged, he became aggressive at us-basically a bully who didnt care about our wellbeing. One more thing to comment on was a phonecall incident. Before we used our room phone we had asked how much the going rate would be for the country we were calling and we were informed by the managing director, Maria Magdalena Wilkes, that it would cost 60 cents per minute. Later on we asked someone else at reception who gave us the same rate (we wanted to doublecheck this since there was no calling rates list in our room) so we made two 10 min calls. So come paying time Maria gives us an invoice totalling almost 20 Euros for what should have cost less than half! After much arguing she begrudgingly let us pay 7 Euros according to the rate prearranged as a "special favour" and told us that phonecalls are more expensive when made outside the hotel. This is complete rubbish as I told her that we had been using an international prepaid phonecard that gave us 25 minutes of talktime for 5 Euros, at which time she became angry & said the case would not be argued. In conclusion, this is an hotel worthy of a 2* rating, and if it had been, we wouldnt have had as much reason to complain. We were most upset with the poor customer service given by every staff member except for the young Indian chap at reception who was always very polite, helpful & attentive. If, at least, staff had been sincerely apologetic & helpful about the situations we were faced with, we feel that we wouldnt have been left with such a negative impression. One final observation: we realise that not every review on this website portrays this hotel as negatively as ours does, and we believe that this may be because half the rooms have been renovated and couples given these rooms will no doubt get a different experience to ours. In addition, the rooms on the first floor have balconies which further add. Perhaps this in itself is enough to negate one's perception of the other aspects of the hotel. All in all we did not enjoy our stay at this hotel and wouldnt dream of going back even if it was free!

Reviews.Title: “What a Shame!”
Reviews.Author: lovelylolita
Reviews.Content: Called the hotel for directions from the train, was told to take the tram. We asked several italians where the tram was - tram - they don't understand that word so it was challenging. My luggage was lost by the airlines, and the front desk did not offer any assistance. Nadeen at the front desk could of been more accomodating. After we checked out we asked to use the restroom and were told there was not a guest restroom. After protesting, Nadeen offered us her restroom. Would not recommend this hotel unless you don't care about customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: perrycrimmins
Reviews.Content: Just up from Manzoni Metro station and round the corner from the Number 3 tram you can get into the Colloseum in 15 mins by tram or 25 if you walk. So add another 5 or 10 respectively for the centre of town. The breakfast is simple but ample with continental offerings and a great cup of coffe if you ask for it to be made fresh. The rooms are smallish but clean although the bedding could be changed if you are there for over a couple of days stay. Really freindly staff who attended to everything we asked also fluent in english unlike me in italian. Good value for money considering where and what you get. We would stay there again as it is a comftable three star hotel. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed out stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this establishment in August 2005. It is a nice, quiet place, but the location is pretty remote for tourist activities. The area feels very safe, but there is a lot of trash and graffiti on the streets. The front desk staff was very friendly, gave us a map of Rome and made some suggestions on what to visit, where to shop and where to eat. There is an excellent restaurant (La ......?) that is within walking distance (close to Manzoni metro station). There is also an excellent gelato store nearby. Ask at the front desk. The rooms themselves are nice, but not real huge. The high ceilings make it seem more spacious than it really is. The air works great, especially when it was hot). The courtyard is beautiful and we enjoyed sitting out there at night. Breakfast isn't anything special, but it is enough to hold you over until lunch. All in all, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall, we were very happy with this hotel. After arriving, the attendent gave us a map, with directions to several restuarants he recommended. He, and all of the other attendents, and even the owner herself, were very friendly and we talked about Rome, and how it compares to other cities, etc., etc. The room was quite nice, and had high speed internet access (free of charge), a TV (with limited channels only in Italian), and a bathroom with shower only. The only complaint is that the water being flushed next door could be heard from our room, but this didn't pose a huge problem. The breakfast selection was good, but not great. We did manage to eat a full breakfast each day, though. Be sure to ask for an espresso coffee (free and unlimited during breakfast, otherwise 1 Euro during the day. The espresso in the hotel and in Italy in general are NOTHING like what is sold in North America; we ended up drinking two or three espressos a day!!). The location of the hotel is not bad. Trams, a metro station and buses are nearby, and the hotel is walking distance from the Coliseum. There aren't many restaurants in the area though. We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Emona, and would definetely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a cute, smallish hotel off the beaten path in Rome, in a nice, quiet area. Our room was swank and well-decorated and spacious, for Europe! By cab, we could get to everywhere pretty quickly -- I loved it! Some problems, however: a young female front desk attendant got snippy when we showed up for breakfast and found the "buffet" foods sparse, pretty much gone. She was supposed to be tending to the food as well, apparently, and she acted like our wanting the meal we paid for was a huge hassle for her. Other front desk people were great, very kind and personable, full of practical info. The day we left, in fact, the owner herself bent over backward to get a cab to the train station for us -- she was great! Only other complaint -- more having to do with location than the actual hotel -- is don't even bother walking around looking for places to eat; except for a locals place around the corner, there's nothing!! Not kidding! The hubby and I walked and walked and walked and found nothing but a couple bars that had some old-looking sammiches and some tiny pizzerias. So save your feet some wear and tear and hail a cab when you're ready for din-din!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: MaggiesWorld
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before taking off for another destination. The hotel is within walking distance of Termini, as well as the Manzoni subway stop. If you're coming from the airport, I would suggest just walking to the hotel from Termini-- it's only about 10 minutes away (keep in mind, however, that the streets are cobblestone and the sidewalks are not much help when you're pulling your luggage). I found that for this location, transferring over to the subway does not really cut much off from your travel time. That said: The hotel was very cute, charming, and clean. I was happily surprised at the size of the bedroom-- it was much larger than I expected. We were on the first floor, and the window faced the street (as well as the front gate), but the noise was not really an issue since we had the air conditioning going. The staff was very accomodating, and even though the room was not equipped with a mini bar, we were able to purchase drinks from the front desk. My favorite part of the hotel was the little gated courtyard. There were a number of lemon and orange trees, as well as carefully-tended roses and herbs. My husband and I enjoyed sitting in the garden late into the night. The hotel was not the cheapest around, but the price was reasonable and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was so great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Daughter and I were there during the Conclave (choosing the new Pope) the hotel was a bit far from the Vatican, but 5 min walk to the metro made it very easy to get there each day. It is only a 15 min walk to the Forum. We stayed next to the receptionist, but in #24 and it was so quiet! We thought we were the only ones on that floor. The breakfast was very fullfilling, cereal, toast, deli meat, crossiants, fruit, oj, what else could you ask for? The staff was very helpful, they gave us a map as soon as we got there, and directed us to a variety places to eat dinner. I felt very safe with the fact you needed to be buzzed in at the gate. The high ceilings and the colors on the walls gave us the feeling we were truly in an Italian Hotel. We would gladly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Be Staying Here Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My room was next door to reception (no. 18) and for the four days that I stayed there I did not sleep a wink. The traffic noise is really bad at night and the electronic buzzer to allow people into the hotel was really annoying (I felt like I was in a doctor's surgery). It wasn't until my friends and I had paid our bill and were about to leave that we noticed the extra 70 euro charge. When I asked what the extra charge was for I was told it was because we had invited a couple of friends to our room and this is against hotel policy.
