This was not mentioned to us when we checked in and they only stayed for a maximum of 2 hours. Since returning to the UK I have been emailing the Manager to try and get a refund without success. I feel that we have been ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay. Had a room with a balcony. Clean and cozy. Great price. Except for the extremely small shower, the bathroom was roomy and clean. 5 minute walk from the Manzoni metro stop. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the Emona”
Reviews.Author: acnova
Reviews.Content: Had a nice stay at the Emona Aquaeductus. The hotel is in a nice location, about a ten minute's walk from the Manzoni station (two stops away from Termini station). The hotel staff is very helpful, especially the owner, Magdalena, who thankfully took pity on my poor Italian and conversed with me in English. The other staff are helpful as well. The room I stayed in (#18) is euro-sized, but comfortable. It is right next to the management desk/area and on the street so it is a bit noisy. What bumps it up from being just average is the large bathroom with the fantastic shower. After a long day of touring, I really looked forward to the massaging jets of the shower module. The free breakfast is okay (coffee from a machine, orange juice, cornflakes, croissants, and deli meats). Overall it was a generally nice place to lay my head.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here the first week of March 2005 and had a lovely time. The bed was great and the location was very central yet away from the crowds. The shutters on the windows were very appreciated as it kept out the street noise and most importantly the sun. If you stay here there is a great pizza place near the metro stop that has a ton of different toppings. There is also a great gellatto (sp?) place nearby. I believe they are both on either side of the Cinema.

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: SM_LB
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel! Arrived late and had a very friendly welcome. Our hotel room (No. 27) was lovely, big bed with French doors out onto a balcony, bathroom with Jacuzzi and lots of space. Room was clean and the hotel location was perfect, about 5 minutes to the metro or 5 minutes to the central tram area. Breakfast was nice, croissants, toast and cereal. Only thing i would say, is shower as early as possible as we didn't have any hot water one morning. Would definitely go back and recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just perfect for our trip. We are a young married couple who are always looking for a fun trip for the right price. If you are like us this is the perfect hotel for you. The room was bigger than we expected and it had a huge tub, which was fun to come back to after walking the streets all day. The breakfast was very filling and delicious. The only negative thing was that the hotel did not have an elevator. This did not bother us at all, but I do know this might have some significance to some of the readers. One more addition... Our trip was in the fall.

Reviews.Title: “View of ancientg aquaduct”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Emona 1/14-1/17. It is about 15-20 minute walk from the Roma Termini and the Colosseum...or 5 minutes from the nearest metro. We walked everywhere and into the night and felt safe at all times. As stated in other reviews, the rooms are small but clean and nice...the noise level is that of a big city...we had no problem sleeping. The staff is incredible and the strength of the Hotel...they took care of us and were very helpful in providing directions and suggestions. The complimentary breakfast is minimal and an area for improvement...with all of the fine pastries in Rome, I would suggest that they serve some for the breakfast. But overall, we enjoyed the stay and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: catht01
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights in mid-December. Friendly staff, clean rooms and nicely decorated. Five minutes walk from Manzoni metro station and felt safe walking from here to the hotel even late at night. Would definitely stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Emona Aquaeductus
HotelInfo.Address: Via Statilia 23, 00185 Rome, Italy
